question: India has the maximum volume of foreign trade with which of the following countries?
explanation:
According to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry, the fifteen largest trading partners of India represent 59.37% of total trade by India in the financial year 2015-2016.[1] These figures include trade in goods and commodities, but do not include services or foreign direct investment.
India\'s largest trade partners with their total trade (sum of imports and exports) in billions of US dollars for the financial year 2017–18 were as follows:
Rank    Country&Region        Exports     Imports    Total Trade
1            China                            16.34          68.06        84.4
2           United States               48.6            25.7           74.3
3          United Arab Emirates  30.29        19.45        49.74
